intro: Liebigia glabra, commonly known as the smooth liebigia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically smooth and hairless, contributing to its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grass family members. Liebigia glabra is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands.
